fields.title: DMCM Home
fields.content:
# Django Markdown Content Manager

Default root (parent) for all DMCM pages on the site.

fields.title: Markdown
fields.content:
# Markdown Samples Contents: [Inline](#inline), [Lists](#lists), [Nested](#nested), [Block](#block), [Code](#code), [Block Quote](#block-quote), [Extras](#extras), [Table of Contents](#table-of-contents), [Tables](#tables). Examples of Markdown and corresponding output used on this site. The full Markdown syntax specification is available at . This site uses the [python-markdown](http://www.freewisdom.org/projects/python-markdown/) implementation with the [tables](http://www.freewisdom.org/projects/python-markdown/Tables) and [table of contents](http://www.freewisdom.org/projects/python-markdown/Table_of_Contents) extras. ## Inline Element |Markdown | Output --------|------------|------------------------ Emphasis|`*Emphasis*`|*Emphasis* String |`**Strong**`|**Strong** Code |\`Code\` |`Code` Link |`[ahernp.com](http://ahernp.com "Ahern, Paul")`|[ahernp.com](http://ahernp.com "Ahern, Paul") Image |`![Paul Ahern](/media/img/ahernp200x200.png "Paul Ahern at Gougane Barra")`|![Paul Ahern](/media/img/ahernp200x200.png "Paul Ahern at Gougane Barra") Thumbnail|`[![Gougane](/media/img/thumb/Gougane.jpg "Church at Gougane Barra")](/media/img/Gougane.jpg)`|[![Gougane](/media/img/thumb/Gougane.jpg "Church at Gougane Barra")](/media/img/Gougane.jpg) Title |`# Title`|

Title

Heading|`## Heading`|

Heading

## Lists * Item * Item `1. Item` 1. Item ### Nested Indent each level by an additional 4 spaces. 1. Install package **numlockx**. 1. Setup Local LAMP server for development: 1. `sudo tasksel install lamp-server` 1. `sudo apt-get install phpmyadmin` 1. Install package **numlockx**. 1. Setup Local LAMP server for development: 1. `sudo tasksel install lamp-server` 1. `sudo apt-get install phpmyadmin` ## Block ### Code Indent by a tab or 4 spaces. ### Block Quote > In a hole in the ground there lived a hobbit. > Not a nasty damp smelly hole filled with the > ends of worms and things. Nor a dry sandy hole > with nothing in it to sit down on or eat. > This was a hobbit-hole and that means comfort. > In a hole in the ground there lived a hobbit. Not a nasty damp smelly hole filled with the > ends of worms and things. Nor a dry sandy hole with nothing in it to sit down on or eat. > This was a hobbit-hole and that means comfort. ## Extras ### Table of Contents 
[TOC]
[TOC] ### Tables Header 1 | Header 2 ---------|--------- Cell 1,1 | Cell 1,2 Cell 2,1 | Cell 2,2 Header 1 | Header 2 ---------|--------- Cell 1,1 | Cell 1,2 Cell 2,1 | Cell 2,2
